commit_message:
pci: nova fail to boot when wrong setting in pci_whitelist

when I wrong config nova.conf with a space in the head of
product_id in pci_whitelist, it would cause the nova-compute
service boot failed. it shows:

Trace:
 get_pci_dev_info(self, 'product_id', MAX_PRODUCT_ID, '%04x')
 File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/pci/devspec.py", line 37, in \
   get_pci_dev_info
   v = get_value(a)
 File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/pci/devspec.py", line 30, in \
   get_value
   return ast.literal_eval("0x" + v)
 File "/usr/lib/python2.7/ast.py", line 49, in literal_eval
   node_or_string = parse(node_or_string, mode='eval')
 File "/usr/lib/python2.7/ast.py", line 37, in parse
   return compile(source, filename, mode, PyCF_ONLY_AST)
 File "<unknown>", line 1
   0x 1347
    ^
SyntaxError: invalid token

this patch fix it.

Closes-bug: #1620434
Change-Id: I1978139b4d2f85bd3018d5d64c73eb2206af3223

subject: imagecache: Hold shared storage registry lock while running
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-06 16:10:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5b3780c5ca255eaeca8967d1c48050529cb8c06b', 'message': 'imagecache: Hold shared storage registry lock while running

This addresses 3 races in image cache:

1. Absent any locking, if the clean job took a very long time to run,
   it was possible for multiple instances of the job to run
   concurrently on the same host. As the job uses global state, this
   will certainly break.

2. When using shared storage, it was possible for a compute host to be
   brought up and create an instance which uses an existing backing
   image before the image cache manager runs for the first time. As
   we only run register_storage_use when the image cache manager runs,
   this means another host running the image cache manager on the same
   storage will not be aware of our instance when choosing which
   images to reap.

3. When using shared storage, it was possible for the image cache
   manager to run concurrently on different hosts. This is complex to
   reason about, and almost certainly fraught with bugs.

(2) and (3) are likely both mitigated if not practically resolved by
change I376cc951. However, a clean lock makes this code much simpler
to reason about.

This does not make this code race free, because we still race with
instance create. Change I376cc951 significantly reduces, but does not
eliminate that race window.

commit_message:
imagecache: Hold shared storage registry lock while running

This addresses 3 races in image cache:

1. Absent any locking, if the clean job took a very long time to run,
   it was possible for multiple instances of the job to run
   concurrently on the same host. As the job uses global state, this
   will certainly break.

2. When using shared storage, it was possible for a compute host to be
   brought up and create an instance which uses an existing backing
   image before the image cache manager runs for the first time. As
   we only run register_storage_use when the image cache manager runs,
   this means another host running the image cache manager on the same
   storage will not be aware of our instance when choosing which
   images to reap.

3. When using shared storage, it was possible for the image cache
   manager to run concurrently on different hosts. This is complex to
   reason about, and almost certainly fraught with bugs.

(2) and (3) are likely both mitigated if not practically resolved by
change I376cc951. However, a clean lock makes this code much simpler
to reason about.

This does not make this code race free, because we still race with
instance create. Change I376cc951 significantly reduces, but does not
eliminate that race window.

Resolves-bug: #1620341
Change-Id: I19d38f076bb1323c157a0bef4bf55ed5b1cf408a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/39/366239/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

It's # important to do this on initialisation as it's important that any # other host running _run_image_cache_manager_pass knows about us # before we create an instances on it. storage_users.register_storage_use_locked(CONF.instances_path, CONF.host) @storage_users.storage_registry_locked

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 07:17:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ccb0a2b53c0df3eed3be80aa437827204e54bfe9', 'message': '[sr-iov] pci passthrough whitelist doesn't support mult node

commit_message:
[sr-iov] pci passthrough whitelist doesn't support multi node

pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address": "0000:0a:00.1",
                             "physical_network": "physnet1"}
If a nova-compute supports multi nodes. The nodes's pci address maybe repeat.
So format above can not describe the situation.
pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address": "0000:0a:00.1",
                             "node": "xxxx",
                             "physical_network": "physnet1"}
The above fomat will work
Closes-Bug: #1612029

Change-Id: I343ed47086e06b40dd3497000748fac374f85aee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/57/354557/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _parse_white_list_from_config(self, whitelists, node_name=None): node = ds.pop("node", None) if node == None or node == node_name: spec = devspec.PciDeviceSpec(ds) specs.append(spec) def __init__(self, whitelist_spec=None, node_name=None): self.specs = self._parse_white_list_from_config(whitelist_spec, node_name) dev_filter = Whitelist(CONF.pci_passthrough_whitelist, node_name=None)
deleted_lines: def _parse_white_list_from_config(self, whitelists): spec = devspec.PciDeviceSpec(ds) specs.append(spec) def __init__(self, whitelist_spec=None): self.specs = self._parse_white_list_from_config(whitelist_spec) dev_filter = Whitelist(CONF.pci_passthrough_whitelist)

commit_message:
Remove provider_fw_rules tables and associated db api methods

Remove the provider_fw_rules tables and associated db api methods
that are no longer used.

Change-Id: I28b48ac585a49bca2c02d637e44a0aa50baea6e3

deleted_lines: def provider_fw_rule_create(context, rule): fw_rule_ref = models.ProviderFirewallRule() fw_rule_ref.update(rule) fw_rule_ref.save() return fw_rule_ref def provider_fw_rule_get_all(context): return model_query(context, models.ProviderFirewallRule).all() def provider_fw_rule_destroy(context, rule_id): session = get_session() with session.begin(): session.query(models.ProviderFirewallRule).\ filter_by(id=rule_id).\ soft_delete() ###################

Partially-Implements: blueprint remove-mox-ocata

Change-Id: Id1afb9dfeec8bac4fc92e59ba67c7b98d985fedb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/66/321966/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.stub_out('nova.compute.api.API.get', fake_compute_get) self.stub_out('nova.compute.api.API.get_all', fake_compute_get_all) self.assertEqual(vm_state, server.get('%svm_state' % self.prefix)) self.assertEqual(power_state, int(server.get('%spower_state' % self.prefix))) self.assertEqual(task_state, server.get('%stask_state' % self.prefix)) self.assertEqual(200, res.status_int) self.assertEqual(200, res.status_int) self.stub_out('nova.compute.api.API.get', fake_compute_get) self.assertEqual(404, res.status_int)
deleted_lines: from nova import compute self.stubs.Set(compute.api.API, 'get', fake_compute_get) self.stubs.Set(compute.api.API, 'get_all', fake_compute_get_all) self.assertEqual(server.get('%svm_state' % self.prefix), vm_state) self.assertEqual(int(server.get('%spower_state' % self.prefix)), power_state) self.assertEqual(server.get('%stask_state' % self.prefix), task_state) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 200) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 200) self.stubs.Set(compute.api.API, 'get', fake_compute_get) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 404)

subject: Add option to disable local disks in flavors [2/3]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-20 11:39:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b740ecdbbe4d95f6bdc31cf9994258f6f7b845a7', 'message': 'Add option to disable local disks in flavors [2/3]

This new feature adds the possibility to define a flavor,
that does not create ephemeral disks on the hypervisor;
A new boolean field 'local_disks' is added to flavors.
If local_disks=False, users are "forced" to create
a bootable volume to launch an instance from that flavor.

This commit is the compute/api.py related part of the
implementation.

Change-Id: I782eb2e8d9bed4818d5d76446eca1da500a7eb8f
Implements: blueprint flavor-root-disk-none

commit_message:
Add option to disable local disks in flavors [2/3]

This new feature adds the possibility to define a flavor,
that does not create ephemeral disks on the hypervisor;
A new boolean field 'local_disks' is added to flavors.
If local_disks=False, users are "forced" to create
a bootable volume to launch an instance from that flavor.

This commit is the compute/api.py related part of the
implementation.

Change-Id: I782eb2e8d9bed4818d5d76446eca1da500a7eb8f
Implements: blueprint flavor-root-disk-none

commit_message:
Enable instance resizing for LVM backed instances

These changes enable the resize operation surrounding LVM backed
instances. If the resize operation is scheduled for the same compute,
then the lvresize command is used to resize the disk. If the resize
operation is scheduled for another compute (cold migration), then the
instance is rebuilt on the new compute with the new size and no local
lvm disk resizing will occur.

Add LVM support functions needed to support resizing LVM backed
instances. This adds rename_volume(), create_duplicate_volume(),
resize_volume(), and get_volume_vg().

Add detection and removal of all LVM disks associated with the instance
that end with "_resize". These LVM disks are the original instance disks
that are preserved prior to attempting the resize/migration operation
performed on the instance. As this operation has been completed, they
must be removed.

Change-Id: I342220c88a2413f610d6bd072391c35ce216e012

commit_message:
WIP: Assign mac address to vf netdevice when using macvtap port

This is a workaround to libvirt issue described here:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1372944. The problem is that
libvirt dosn't update the mac address of the netdevice, instead it uses
netlink to configure the mac address of the VF. For macvtap to work
libvirt should set the mac address on the VF net device and using
netlink. Until this is fixed we should set both of them in nova.

Closes-Bug: #1622292

Change-Id: Ib4919c2db48ae7256d7e22b1abbd6525ea0929df

commit_message:
filters: remove the local full/part msg variable

the local full/part msg variable just used to format
the output log, we exactly don't need them.

Since the LOG.output translates the message is delayed to be
handled by logging code, so the message got from mock_log.
call_args is not translated. we should force translating it
beforce assertIn.

Change-Id: Id34eeaf23d39f30351660a3de58c5efa03626f4f

Deallocate instance allocation by rp_uuid and consumer_id

update_instance_allocation only remove the allocation for consumer
on specfic ResourceProvider.

commit_message:
Add API for delete allocations by RP_UUID and CONSUMER_ID

For support move_claim with placement API, it needs an API to drop the
claim on the source or destination host.

The current API 'DELETE /allocations/{consumer_id}' will remove all the
allocations for the specific instance. It leads to the resource consuming
will be drop both on the source and destination host.

This patch adds new API:
'DELETE /resource_providers/{rp_uuid}/allocations/{consumer_id}'

This API support to drop allocation on specific ResourceProvider. It will
be used to implement the move_claim drop.

Change-Id: Iacb1ea2017b1f9069802e30efb5b48d35e00488a
Partial-Bug: #1621709
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/72/369172/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Retain ucast_macs_remote if l2gw connection exists

In a scenario, where network is a part of multiple
l2-gateway-connections, retain ucast_macs_remote entries
in ovsdb until the last l2-gateway-connection is deleted
for that network.

Closes-Bug: 1607399

(cherry picked from commit cdded15b4dea474d65730f81245590e734b9594c)


Change-Id: I6d63c5ff0c3c9d208612eeec25351977a40820c0

commit_message:
Remove solum-infra-guestagent from solum governance

As we discussed in mail list[0] and IRC meeting[1], we decided
remove solum-infra-guestagent from solum governance.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/106387.html
[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/solum_team_meeting/2016/solum_team_meeting.2016-11-09-14.00.log.html

Change-Id: Ifdfba313a8b8e4b93e9270ec6a374adbec71ebf4

commit_message:
Do not re-set the members cache for watchers by default

The current code fills the group membership cache by default  without
any check for data already been there - which can lead to a race
condition in the following situation:

 coord1.watch_group_join(x, cb1) # Cache is filled: contains {}
 coord2.join_group(x)
 coord1.watch_group_join(x, cb2) # Cache is re-filled: contains {coord2}
 coord1.run_watchers() # Calls nothing since no new join is seen whereas
                       # it should call cb1

Change-Id: I7376c9f320a37bb44282b52fa5b6fa3f1f86784b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tooz refs/changes/52/398352/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def _init_watch_group(self, group_id): members = self.get_members(group_id) self._group_members[group_id].update(members.get(timeout=None)) def watch_join_group(self, group_id, callback): self._init_watch_group(group_id) return super(RedisDriver, self).watch_join_group(group_id, callback) def watch_leave_group(self, group_id, callback): self._init_watch_group(group_id) return super(RedisDriver, self).watch_leave_group(group_id, callback)

commit_message:
coordination: renforce event based testing

The current test plan only check for the last event being created. In
the case an implementation is broken and emits more than 1 event when
running watchers, the tests would not see the difference.

This patch makes sure nothing is broken.

Change-Id: I14575a6ba86798d925e345c4a4c5190223ab8ec9

commit_message:
Factorize member_id in the base coordinator class

Any coordinator that implements (and they all should) group membership
needs a member_id field and copy it to self. Just do that by default for
all driver at __init__ time.

Change-Id: I66d82815afd4c6e9354212e5ab3fba17931c1bbc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tooz refs/changes/72/397772/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use the internal group of list rather than listing the groups

For an unknown reason, the common run_watchers implementation prefers to
list the group using the driver rather than using the groups that
actually have hooks. This simplify the code and save us from a
round-trip of getting the list of group.

Change-Id: Ice06b8282a8c48fc4963b451a8a3e03b6684e90f

commit_message:
Move the cached-based watcher implementation into its own class

There's a lot of methods implementing the common watcher tools that are
inherited from all drivers whereas there is no need for that. The mixin
is actually not correctly designed, as it mixes the hooks and the cache
code.

This splits out the common implementation into its common class that can
be inherited to implement this model of driver.

The Kazoo and Zake drivers are also merged to simplify code, as the base
class was not used.

Change-Id: I1acbf1983165d00e68b96cbca2bc5c1e2acadfa8

added_lines: super(CoordinationDriver, self).__init__() @staticmethod def watch_join_group(group_id, callback): raise tooz.NotImplemented @staticmethod def unwatch_join_group(group_id, callback): raise tooz.NotImplemented @staticmethod def watch_leave_group(group_id, callback): raise tooz.NotImplemented @staticmethod def unwatch_leave_group(group_id, callback): raise tooz.NotImplemented @staticmethod def watch_elected_as_leader(group_id, callback): raise tooz.NotImplemented @staticmethod def unwatch_elected_as_leader(group_id, callback): raise tooz.NotImplemented def __init__(self): super(_RunWatchersMixin, self).__init__() # A cache for group members self._group_members = collections.defaultdict(set) def watch_join_group(self, group_id, callback): self._hooks_join_group[group_id].append(callback) def unwatch_join_group(self, group_id, callback): try: self._hooks_join_group[group_id].remove(callback) except ValueError: raise WatchCallbackNotFound(group_id, callback) if (not self._has_hooks_for_group(group_id) and group_id in self._group_members): del self._group_members[group_id] def watch_leave_group(self, group_id, callback): self._hooks_leave_group[group_id].append(callback) def unwatch_leave_group(self, group_id, callback): try: self._hooks_leave_group[group_id].remove(callback) except ValueError: raise WatchCallbackNotFound(group_id, callback) if (not self._has_hooks_for_group(group_id) and group_id in self._group_members): del self._group_members[group_id] if not self._hooks_leave_group[group_id]: del self._hooks_leave_group[group_id] def watch_elected_as_leader(self, group_id, callback): self._hooks_elected_leader[group_id].append(callback) def unwatch_elected_as_leader(self, group_id, callback): try: self._hooks_elected_leader[group_id].remove(callback) except ValueError: raise WatchCallbackNotFound(group_id, callback) if not self._hooks_elected_leader[group_id]: del self._hooks_elected_leader[group_id]

commit_message:
Add Intructions to run Functional Tests

Change-Id: Ibe43dac24aabe9d5bace5fb07f9a277bd97c58bb
Closes-Bug: #1647516
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/78/407678/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Running Functional Tests ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Functional tests (networking-odl/tests/functional/) are intended to validate actual system interaction. Mocks should be used sparingly, if at all. Care should be taken to ensure that existing system resources are not modified and that resources created in tests are properly cleaned up both on test success and failure. First make sure all the dependencies are configured. There is a script in tools/ to configure environment for functional tests. To configure environment:: ./tools/configure_for_func_testing.sh To run all functional tests :: tox -e dsvm-functional

commit_message:
Add a check to make sure the right assert* method is used

It is recommended to use
assert{Greater,GreaterEqual,Less,LessEqual,Equal,NotEqual} rather than
assertTrue(comparison).

Change-Id: Idd57a5e7897b839707371033d7f25604d44e9cd9

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-28 01:52:37.000000000', 'files': ['osprofiler/profiler.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/osprofiler/commit/6a83e1ce5cd6df61bf233789ff72ff0a1d81f521', 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable. 2.In py2, the performance about list
should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: If93f87da6853b4e1bb29bd421520f1e74897c6eb

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable. 2.In py2, the performance about list
should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: If93f87da6853b4e1bb29bd421520f1e74897c6eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osprofiler refs/changes/68/403468/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: import six for attr_name, attr_value in six.iteritems(attrs):

Use oslo_utils.uuidutils.is_uuid_like

Using oslo_utils.uuidutils.is_uuid_like() to check if the trace
positional argument to "trace show" command is a trace ID or a
file name containing the trace.

commit_message:
Error out for invalid trace ID

There is no error message printed if the trace ID input to the
'trace show' command is invalid. Fixing this by checking for
empty child nodes at the root of the trace result from driver.

Change-Id: I8fc40356cffa98f5e9b9f6048b8fe422271f41f0
Closes-bug: #1644448

commit_message:
HyperVClusterDriver: ignores non-nova instances

If a failover occurs for a non-nova instance, the
HyperVClusterDriver will now ignore that instance.

Closes-Bug: #1646804

Change-Id: If523bba8339d557bc50be17f83404d06882fe9f8
(cherry picked from commit de567defd2d3b599b9449d415a80ff4e1ebfeb4c)

commit_message:
Add initial specification for MoltenIron

Change-Id: I7322c2c665970bd1a2900bd5b14e7ed88c02120b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/18/387418/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========== Molten Iron =========== https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1633540 Running Ironic on a set of Bare Metal machines needs a database and library to help manage the pool. Problem description =================== When running a Continuous Integration environment, many patches need to be tested. While one could theoretically configure one Bare Metal machine in an Ironic setup, you are limited to being able to test one patch at a time. Therefore, we need to maintain a pool of Bare Metal machines that are able to accept testing a patch. We need a system to manage the pool and also to allocate and release machines in the pool. Proposed change =============== We will create a new client/server tool that uses a database server as the back end. This is intended to be a lightweight solution. Alternatives ------------ Just use one machine to handle the queue of patches. However, the Ironic job is limited to 1 job at a time (with 1 Bare Metal machine). It is slow but arguably sufficient. We could potentially use nodepool. However, nodepool uses virtual machines and we want a pool of bare metal machines. Also, there is no storage of bare metal controller information such as username, password, and IP address. Also, nodepool interfaces with jenkins or zuul after the machine has been brought up which we do not want. Security impact --------------- There is no security for the MoltenIron REST api. Any security is handled by the underlying database application. Other end user impact --------------------- There is no other end user interaction with MoltenIron aside from the CLI. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Who is leading the writing of the code? Or is this a blueprint where you're throwing it out there to see who picks it up? If more than one person is working on the implementation, please designate the primary author and contact. Primary assignee: mark-hamzy Other contributors: mjturek Testing ======= Testing is handled by tox running a set of testcases.

commit_message:
Include feedback from the BoD and UC Community

This commit includes all the changes requested by both
the BoD and the UC Community in order to approve the
Bylaws changes in order to make the UC as equivalent
as possible to the TC.

Change-Id: I309e6b9a6ed4a6891b9ffe41fed09c84d962a977
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance-uc refs/changes/18/404318/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The User Committees (UC) mission is to serve the user community of OpenStack, representing them to the broader community (including the Technical Committee, Board of Directors, Projects and PTLs, and projects outside OpenStack). The UC recognizes competence and contribution, and when necessary resolves disputes in accordance with the OpenStack Code of Conduct. The UC keeps track of OpenStack deployments and usage, helping to share user stories and experiences. The User Committee works with user groups worldwide to keep the community vibrant and informed.The User Committee (UC) will consist of at least five members. Beginning with the first election, all members selected to the UC shall be Individual Members and Active User Contributors (AUC) based on the definition in the next section. A member of the UC may cease to be an Individual Member during her or his term, but must be an Individual Member at the time of nomination and election. The UC shall organize its meetings and may, create elected seats to be filled by a vote of the Individual Members recognized as AUCs. Active User Contributors (AUC) ==============================
deleted_lines: The User Committees (UC) mission is to consolidate users requirements and present these to the Technical Committee (TC) for their evaluation and proper execution. It provides guidance for the development team where user feedback is requested. The UC manages and coordinates both working groups and functional teams to help them to become successful in their individual goals and make a difference in the community. It keeps track of OpenStack deployments and usage, helping to share user stories and experiences. UC defines the expected activities from the users in order to be recognized as active members and be granted with the AUC (Active User Contributor) status. Finally, the UC works with user groups worldwide to keep the community vibrant and informed.The User Committee (UC) is comprised of at least three Individual Members, one appointed by the Technical Committee, one appointed by the Board of Directors, and one appointed by the appointees of the Technical Committee and Board of Directors. The User Committee shall organize its meetings and may, on approval of the Board of Directors, create elected seats to be filled by a vote of the Individual Members recognized as AUC. Active User Contributors ========================

commit_message:
Add exception to trace point details

Adding exception raised by the method to its corresponding
trace point details.

Change-Id: I8bdaee1f4eaf8cd7875c5264519e03f2d04ea12a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osprofiler refs/changes/39/399439/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.result[trace_id]["info"]["exception"] = "None" if raw_payload and "info" in raw_payload: exc = raw_payload["info"].get("etype", "None") self.result[trace_id]["info"]["exception"] = exc

commit_message:
Update Amulet defs, series metadata and c-h sync

- Sync charm helpers if applicable.

- Fix test executable hashbangs for virtualenv prep.

- Add Yakkety-Newton Amulet test definitions.

- Prep Xenial-Ocata Amulet test definitions (not yet enabled).

- Prep Zesty-Ocata Amulet test definitions (not yet enabled).

- Remove Precise charm series metadata if present.

- Remove Precise Amulet test definitions if present.

Change-Id: I208d5dbce19a3740ad3a78dd2f8f319812bd60c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-designate refs/changes/30/401430/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # Copyright 2016 Canonical Ltd # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. """Amulet tests on a basic aodh deployment on xenial-ocata.""" from basic_deployment import DesignateBasicDeployment if __name__ == '__main__': deployment = DesignateBasicDeployment( series='xenial', openstack='cloud:xenial-ocata', source='cloud:xenial-updates/ocata') deployment.run_tests()

commit_message:
Files with no code must be left completely empty

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:
[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: I1b4e87d12ade01d9ce2658a6e6533acb1fd9b5c3

commit_message:
Add RPCs to support volume target operations

This patch adds the following two RPCs in order to support
volume target operations in Ironic.

- update_volume_target()
  This function is called to update the information about a volume
  target that is stored in the database.

- destroy_volume_target()
  This function is called to remove a volume target from the database.

Co-Authored-By: Stephane Miller <stephane@alum.mit.edu>
Co-Authored-By: Ruby Loo <ruby.loo@intel.com>
Change-Id: I2925c081da4bb0a77edd5c579f92aaa0f5999b78
Partial-Bug: 1526231

added_lines: def get_test_volume_target(ctxt, **kw): """Return a VolumeTarget object with appropriate attributes. NOTE: The object leaves the attributes marked as changed, such that a create() could be used to commit it to the DB. """ db_volume_target = db_utils.get_test_volume_target(**kw) # Let DB generate ID if it isn't specified explicitly if 'id' not in kw: del db_volume_target['id'] volume_target = objects.VolumeTarget(ctxt) for key in db_volume_target: setattr(volume_target, key, db_volume_target[key]) return volume_target def create_test_volume_target(ctxt, **kw): """Create and return a test target object. Create a target in the DB and return a VolumeTarget object with appropriate attributes. """ volume_target = get_test_volume_target(ctxt, **kw) volume_target.create() return volume_target

commit_message:
Remove test of having a thundering herd

The important test is the following one, which tests that we prevent
thundering herds. The test that we _have_ one is subject to a race
condition where the mocks execute so quickly that we don't herd even
without the protection. But that's ok - it's ok for a herd to
accidentally not happen. So remove the test which is just false-negative
noise.

Change-Id: I10c418a2c4ba2d8d1b0b3a22516bff2a688555a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/94/406494/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def test_list_servers_herd(self, nova_mock): self.cloud._SERVER_AGE = 0 fake_server = fakes.FakeServer('1234', '', 'ACTIVE') nova_mock.servers.list.return_value = [fake_server] with concurrent.futures.ThreadPoolExecutor(16) as pool: for i in range(16): pool.submit(lambda: self.cloud.list_servers()) # It's possible to race-condition 16 threads all in the # single initial lock without a tiny sleep time.sleep(0.001) self.assertGreater(nova_mock.servers.list.call_count, 1) @mock.patch('shade.OpenStackCloud.nova_client')

revisions:

It isn't possible for automated tasks to determine which accounts are

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I68984e72cfb2073a6b3bbe98cd935632c3be138f
"}]
commit_message:
[Docs] Exception for removing unnecessary accounts

It isn't possible for automated tasks to determine which accounts are
unnecessary. Deployers must perform these audits manually.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I68984e72cfb2073a6b3bbe98cd935632c3be138f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/04/407004/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: status: exception - manual intervention tag: authDeployers are strongly urged to review the list of user accounts on each server regularly. Evaluation of user accounts must be done on a case-by-case basis and the tasks in the security role are unable to determine which user accounts are valid. Deployers must complete this work manually.
deleted_lines: status: not implemented tag: miscThis STIG requirement is not yet implemented.

commit_message:
Run cue jobs on Xenial

Part of the transition to Xenial. Cue only has a master branch so just
shift ahead to Xenial.

commit_message:
Move castellan functional job to Xenial

Part of the transition to Xenial. Castellan only has a master branch so
we don't need to keep old branches on Trusty.

Change-Id: I9bcb26c58f56f02c3e9de249523bfa7ca856c765

Run blazar devstack job on Xenial

Blazar only has a master branch. So shift its devstack job ahead to
Xenial.

commit_message:
Run bifrost integration jobs on Xenial

Part of the transition to Xenial. For changes to branches >= newton run
these jobs on Xenial. Changes to older branches continue to run on
Trusty.

Change-Id: I678132cc05156ff3795a5694a54044e72d236221

commit_message:
Run beaker-(localhost|nodepool) rake jobs on Xenial

These projects don't have any code yet. Just shift their testing ahead
to Xenial so the testing is ready when the code arrives.

Change-Id: I933389d08d15c40428f507f9cd268e74d2fb2403

commit_message:
Run gate-bashate-devstack on Xenial

This is a job that runs bashate against devstack. Just push it ahead to
run on Xenial since bashate only has a master branch.

Change-Id: Ib78ab51bc6ad78ae5695a85f45e72592be621846

commit_message:
Run barbican plugin jobs on Xenial

Shift barbican plugin testing ahead to run on Xenial for changes against
branches >= newton. Older branches continue to run on Trusty. Note for
the one experimental job it is only set to run on Xenial because it was
already restricted to >= newton.

Change-Id: If8ff8a9efcb12ca8756c058b797ff1fa7f2d897b

commit_message:
[Docs] Exception for user init file umask

Changing user initialization files in their home directories can be
disruptive. This patch adds docs to explain that.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I4ea76bc0bb27723788d9c0425f45b0b39aceea82
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/64/407164/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: status: exception - manual intervention tag: file_permsAlthough the STIG requires that all local interactive user accounts have a umask of ``077``, this change can be disruptive for users and the applications they run. This change cannot be applied in an automated way. Deployers should review user initialization files regularly to ensure that the umask is not specified. This allows the system-wide setting of ``077`` to be applied to all user sessions.
deleted_lines: status: not implemented tag: miscThis STIG requirement is not yet implemented.

commit_message:
Add VolumeTarget object

This patch adds the VolumeTarget object. It handles the
volume target information which is stored in the database.

Co-Authored-By: Stephane Miller <stephane@alum.mit.edu>
Co-Authored-By: Ruby Loo <ruby.loo@intel.com>
Change-Id: I814454ec5a515080d21aad58f8d43abb49b77fb3
Partial-Bug: 1526231

commit_message:
Gather facts before running first role requiring them

The pip_install role is using variables requiring facts to be
present. The best way to fix this issue is to gather_facts
in the bootstrap-aio playbook.

Change-Id: Idfbcf54faa90013d229b415463ce664dbda7f334
Closes-Bug: 1647481
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/35/407435/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: gather_facts: True

commit_message:
[Docs] Exceptions for filesystem mounts

Adjusting filesystem mounts can cause serious disruptions, so these tasks are
left up to deployers to complete manually.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I9835db5092268ef8bb61dbfe54febfb1b6005abd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/50/407150/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: status: exception - manual interventionDeployers should examine any filesystem mounts that contain home directories to ensure that the ``nosetuid`` option is set.
deleted_lines: status: not implementedThis STIG requirement is not yet implemented.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 19:59:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security/commit/3f70bf431c9ee5d3acddd0dd0562cb0499d0ab59', 'message': "[Docs] Exception for cron logging

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-05 21:44:53.000000000', 'files': ['doc/metadata/rhel7/RHEL-07-021160.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security/commit/85a337b6f773480961fe3cc54d094b3b6f2a0153', 'message': "[Docs] Exception for cron logging

commit_message:
[Docs] Exception for cron logging

All distributions supported by the role already collect cron logs. The
role won't change the syslog configuration from the default.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Iea82aa6f2fc81b40d5488a56ee7382b3ef6a2eab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/70/407170/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: status: exception - manual interventionUbuntu, CentOS and Red Hat Enterprise Linux already capture the logs from cron. Ubuntu systems collect it into the main syslog file (``/var/log/syslog``) rather than separate it into its own log file. CentOS and Red Hat Enterprise Linux systems collect cron logs in ``/var/log/cron``. Deployers should not need to adjust these configurations unless a specific environment requires it. The tasks in the security role do not make changes to the ``rsyslog`` configuration.
deleted_lines: status: not implementedThis STIG requirement is not yet implemented.

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/2b00c35799734733ecdec861c74975d8\n'

Change-Id: If27279ec325cefdf713dc924617429afc0834c87

commit_message:
Fix download url for keystone-auth

Deliverable name is not the same as the tarball name for
keystoneauth. We need to specify tarball-base for the
url to be composed correctly

commit_message:
functional test: configure opendaylight

opendaylight is necessary to run functional tests.
So install odl and run it.

Change-Id: I8e8c6e01b0bdf4caf11f3477bfd6ffb44fe066ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/25/404525/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function _install_infra { echo_summary "Installing infra" source $DEVSTACK_PATH/lib/infra install_infra } function _install_opendaylight { echo_summary "Install OpenDaylight" NETWORKING_ODL_DIR=$REPO_BASE/networking-odl # openstack service provider isn't needed, only ODL neutron northbound # is necessary for functional test ODL_NETVIRT_KARAF_FEATURE=odl-neutron-service,odl-restconf-all,odl-aaa-authn,odl-dlux-core,odl-mdsal-apidocs,odl-neutron-logger ODL_BOOT_WAIT_URL=controller/nb/v2/neutron/networks source $NETWORKING_ODL_DIR/devstack/settings.odl set +e curl -o /dev/null --fail --silent --head -u \ ${ODL_USERNAME}:${ODL_PASSWORD} \ http://${ODL_MGR_IP}:${ODL_PORT}/${ODL_BOOT_WAIT_URL} lcoal result=$? set -e if [ $result -eq 0 ]; then echo_summary "OpenDaylight config appears to be complete, skipping" return 0 fi enable_service odl-server source $NETWORKING_ODL_DIR/devstack/plugin.sh stack install source $NETWORKING_ODL_DIR/devstack/plugin.sh stack post-config } _install_infra _install_opendaylight

subject: Add network templates for multiple NICs with flat and VLAN tagged networks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-18 22:49:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/a97ba4dfe4882728b2352ef3ca024eb4c7afaa80', 'message': 'Add network templates for multiple NICs with flat and VLAN tagged networks

This change adds a set of network interface configurations and an example
environment file for using multiple NICs with both flat and VLAN tagged
networks. These templates assume that nic1 is used for provisioning
(ctlplane), nic2 is used as a VLAN trunk network (br-isolated) for
traffic isolation and nic3 is used for both public/external API traffic
(br-ex).

Change-Id: If7a93c03627a5249c8e5a57a82c3583e45da4621
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-16 05:59:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/472bb999e2c8b75aaacfd745b606bd7611e90af9', 'message': 'Add network templates for multiple NICs with flat and VLAN tagged networks

This change adds a set of network interface configurations and an example
environment file for using multiple NICs with both flat and VLAN tagged
networks. These templates assume that nic1 is used for provisioning
(ctlplane), nic2 is used as a VLAN trunk network (br-isolated) for
traffic isolation and nic3 is used for both public/external API traffic

commit_message:
Add network templates for multiple NICs with flat and VLAN tagged networks

This change adds a set of network interface configurations and an example
environment file for using multiple NICs with both flat and VLAN tagged
networks. These templates assume that nic1 is used for provisioning
(ctlplane), nic2 is used as a VLAN trunk network (br-isolated) for
traffic isolation and nic3 is used for both public/external API traffic
(br-ex).

Change-Id: If7a93c03627a5249c8e5a57a82c3583e45da4621
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/72/214372/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This directory contains Heat templates to help configure VLANs in an environment with multiple NICs for each overcloud role. The templates also specify the external/public API access on a dedicated flat network on the controller, using the standard br-ex bridge name. The configurations assume the following- **eth0/nic1** is PXE/management (ctlplane) **eth1/nic2** is a trunked VLAN interface **eth2/nic3** is the public API/external network Configuration ------------- To make use of these templates create a Heat environment that looks something like this: resource\_registry: OS::TripleO::BlockStorage::Net::SoftwareConfig: network/config/multiple-nic-vlans/cinder-storage.yaml OS::TripleO::Compute::Net::SoftwareConfig: network/config/multiple-nic-vlans/compute.yaml OS::TripleO::Controller::Net::SoftwareConfig: network/config/multiple-nic-vlans/controller.yaml OS::TripleO::ObjectStorage::Net::SoftwareConfig: network/config/multiple-nic-vlans/swift-storage.yaml OS::TripleO::CephStorage::Net::SoftwareConfig: network/config/multiple-nic-vlans/ceph-storage.yaml Or use this Heat environment file: environments/net-multiple-nic-with-vlans.yaml

commit_message:
Set check_exit_code to False for ifup

This change set the check_exit_code to False for ifup,
such that when ifup an interface fails for whatever
reason, os-net-config can continue to bring up other
interfaces.

os-net-config brings up interfaces in a for loop, if
the pxe interface is not the first interface of the
for loop and the ifup of other interfaces fail, exception
will be raised and the pxe interface will never be
brought up, which further breaks the entire openstack
installation.

Change-Id: I7a8a2359db01f545128f550ad5a6d18d8f5a4e40

commit_message:
Change nova service's name for v3 to novav3.

A common convention for naming nova service's name for v3 endpoint is to
use novav3/computev3.  This patch enforce this convention.

It also unlocks a blocker for this patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/234704 where puppet is unable to handle
services only different by type.  This is being fixed here
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238954/ but as it's a backward
incompatible change it may take some time to get to master.

This also fixes the red-hat bugzilla.

Change-Id: Ic5997b237ebe052b6db08508cd7c1e85b2093a1d
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1236989

commit_message:
Add AMT support

This change adds the last missing part to be able to deploy TripleO
on AMT-based boxes (like the Intel NUC).

NB: Centos/Rhel 7 users are affected by RHBZ#1319949, which needs fixing
when AMT is configured to use unencrypted http.

Change-Id: I46dabb55ed4351e5581be2953b14b7175957a69d
Depends-On: Ide3697bcd9a27da533ba1dbbe04c261efb869701
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/90/295690/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if node['pm_type'] == 'pxe_amt': self.log.debug("Identified baremetal AMT node") port = "16992" if node['pm_protocol'] == 'https': port = "16993" cmd = ('wsman -V -v identify -h %s --port %s -u %s ' '--password=\'%s\'' % (node['pm_addr'], port, node['pm_user'], node['pm_password'])) self.log.debug("Executing: %s", cmd) status = utils.run_shell(cmd) if status != 0: self.log.error('ERROR: wsmanfailed') self.error_count += 1 baremetal_ips.append(node['pm_addr'])

commit_message:
Amend --ntp-server help message to add support for multiple servers

This commit amends the help message for the --ntp-server flag to mention
that it support a comma separated list of ntp servers.

It also reflect the change in the parameter name from NtpServer to
NtpServers.

Example

openstack overcloud deploy --templates --ntp-server
0.centos.pool.org --ntp-server 1.centos.pool.org

Depends-On: I4925ef1cf1e565d789981e609c88a07b6e9b28de
Change-Id: Ifb3497a025268022791900faced7cd475b3f0840

commit_message:
Warn when silently ignoring executable files

This provides a first step to prevent users from accidentally naming
their script something that won't be executed. Eventually we should
deprecate this and disallow having executable files in .d that aren't
going to be executed.

Change-Id: Iec8b877ea1b8338aa20cc14e6e07ba24ca6234cd
Closes-Bug: #1452509
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dib-utils refs/changes/07/180807/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
unfiltered_targets=$(find $target_dir -maxdepth 1 -xtype f -executable -printf '%f
' | LANG=C sort -n || echo "") if [ "$targets" != "$unfiltered_targets" ] ; then targets_tmp=$(mktemp /tmp/dib.targets.XXXXXXXX) sed -e 's/ /
/g' > $targets_tmp <<<$targets uf_targets_tmp=$(mktemp /tmp/dib.uf_targets.XXXXXXXX) sed -e 's/ /
/g' > $uf_targets_tmp <<<$unfiltered_targets echo "*******" echo "WARNING: the following executable scripts in $target_dir do not" echo " match $allowed_regex and will not be executed. You may" echo " want to use the install-static element to copy files" echo " into the target from a different directory." echo "" comm -13 $targets_tmp $uf_targets_tmp echo "*******" echo "" rm -f $targets_tmp rm -f $uf_targets_tmp fi

commit_message:
Ensure cinder-volume will survive reboot on PoC deployments

On PoC deployments reboot of controller means that loopback device
providing cinder-volume won't exist. We need to add service that
recreates it before starting cinder-volume service.

Change-Id: I760e1be40580f49f5fdf28432f9ca97f79f75a2e

commit_message:
Don't use guest as rabbitmq user

By default guest user is forbidden to connect to anything else than
 localhost. We should use separate rabbitmq user on overcloud.

Closes-Bug: #1587961

Change-Id: Ic30e73dea06b3fe64e1c16315b2daf45d2a2a15b

commit_message:
WIP - Python script to build inventory file

Ideally this script would be run as an ansible module.

Change-Id: Ibc97e287d6bf1a215003af08e07861dcca4104ca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/93/322593/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
#!/usr/bin/python import os import sys import shade import shade.inventory def get_overcloud_host_groups(inventory): overcloud_hosts = {} for server in inventory.list_hosts(): hostname = server['name'] host_ip = server['interface_ip'] overcloud_hosts[hostname] = host_ip return overcloud_hosts def build_inventory_file(overcloud_hosts): inventory_file = open('overcloud_inventory', 'w') inventory_file.write('
[Controller]
') for hostname in overcloud_hosts: if 'controller' in hostname: inventory_file.write(overcloud_hosts.get(hostname)+'
') inventory_file.write('
[Compute]
') for hostname in overcloud_hosts: if 'compute' in hostname: inventory_file.write(overcloud_hosts.get(hostname)+'
') def main(): inventory = shade.inventory.OpenStackInventory() try: inventory = shade.inventory.OpenStackInventory() overcloud_hosts = get_overcloud_host_groups(inventory) build_inventory_file(overcloud_hosts) except shade.OpenStackCloudException as e: response = ('%s
' % e.message) print(response) sys.exit(1) sys.exit(0) if __name__ == '__main__': main()

commit_message:
Add ability to use NFS as a backend of nova instances

This change introduces the ability to store the nova
instances files on an NFS share. This is done by mounting
the /var/lib/nova/instances directory on the compute nodes
from an NFS location specified in an environment file.

Change-Id: I89c4470c5be4438233c6ea9a629a67b90242598f

Effective when NovaEnableNfsBackend is true. type: string NovaNfsServers: default: '' description: > NFS servers used by Nova NFS backend. Effective when NovaEnableNfsBackend is true. type: comma_delimited_list nova_enable_nfs_backend: {get_input: nova_enable_nfs_backend} nova_nfs_mount_options: {get_input: nova_nfs_mount_options} nova_nfs_servers: {get_input: nova_nfs_servers} nova_enable_nfs_backend: {get_param: NovaEnableNfsBackend} nova_nfs_mount_options: {get_param: NovaNfsMountOptions} nova_nfs_servers: str_replace: template: SERVERS params: SERVERS: {get_param: NovaNfsServers}

This patch is the first step in enabling SR/IOV to be supported
via TripleO. This is usually a completely manual setup, and can
cause problems where 'sriovnicswitch' is removed from the list

"}]
commit_message:
Adds support for SRIOV via NeutronMechanismDrivers

This patch is the first step in enabling SR/IOV to be supported
via TripleO. This is usually a completely manual setup, and can
cause problems where 'sriovnicswitch' is removed from the list
of mechanism drivers when a stack-update takes place. This line
could be added to any environment file, but thought it best to
add in separately as it's somewhat uncommon and we need a
placeholder for Nova PCI device lists.

Change-Id: I6993f18f3d1e5815d0d08623b8b120215f15dd9e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/79/314279/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ## A Heat environment file which can be used to enable SR/IOV parameter_defaults: ## NOTE: By default, only Open vSwitch is enabled. ## Only uncomment one of the following options # To enable both Open vSwitch *and* SR/IOV #NeutronMechanismDrivers: openvswitch,sriovnicswitch # To *only* enable SR/IOV #NeutronMechanismDrivers: sriovnicswitch

commit_message:
Containerized Mariadb Composable Service

Puppet provides the configs, Heat setups up the
environment, and Ansible deploys the service.

Change-Id: I15df888de83c3dde88cebfe49174fefc5f8d713a
Co-authored-by: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint containerize-tripleo
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/81/309081/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash KOLLA_GLOBALS=/kolla/etc/kolla/globals.yml KOLLA_PASSWORD_TEMPLATE=/kolla/etc/kolla/passwords.yml ETC_GLOBALS=/etc/kolla/globals.yml n=': "no"' y=': "yes"' initial_service_list=(enable_central_logging enable_ceph enable_ceph_rgw enable_cinder enable_heat enable_horizon enable_ironic enable_magnum enable_manila enable_mistral enable_mongodb enable_murano enable_swift enable_glance enable_haproxy enable_keystone enable_memcached enable_neutron enable_nova enable_rabbitmq enable_mariadb) initialize_globals(){ local service_yes=$1$y local service_no=$1$n if grep -q "^$service_yes" $ETC_GLOBALS; then sed -i "s/^$service_yes/$service_no/" $ETC_GLOBALS elif grep -Fxq "$service_no" $ETC_GLOBALS; then : else echo $service_no >> $ETC_GLOBALS fi } enable_services(){ local service_yes=$1$y local service_no=$1$n if grep -q "^$service_no" $ETC_GLOBALS; then sed -i "s/^$service_no/$service_yes/" $ETC_GLOBALS fi } service_list=$heat_service_list enable_services=$heat_enable_services initialize_globals=$heat_initialize_globals if [ -z "$service_list" ]; then service_list="${initial_service_list[@]}" cp $KOLLA_GLOBALS $ETC_GLOBALS cp $KOLLA_PASSWORD_TEMPLATE $ETC_GLOBALS fi echo initial_sevice_list: ${initial_service_list[@]} echo service_list: ${service_list[@]} echo enable_services: $enable_services for service in ${service_list[@]}; do if [ -n "$enable_services" ]; then enable_services $service elif [ -n "$initialize_globals" ]; then mkdir -p /var/log/kolla/$service mkdir -p /etc/kolla/$service initialize_globals $service fi done

commit_message:
Pass the endpoint ports and protocols through to hiera

This makes the various endpoint protocol/port/url settings available to
the puppet modules for when we switch over to managing everything through
puppet rather than os-apply-config

Change-Id: Idbac7c41cf7a7e615546df69fa391ca053643800

subject: Fixup default open_files_limit for galera
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-10 12:42:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/4e41b7ec41829c9ddb7799cd35b32369b1dae4fc', 'message': "Fixup default open_files_limit for galera

We are currently setting this to -1, which is not a valid
value according to mariadb docs (see bug report below).
This review just makes the value 0, on the assumption that
the -1 was meant to represent 'infinite'. Note that at
least in the pacemaker case we *are* passing 16384 to the
resource arguments with --open-files-limit=16384

Fixes Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1524809

Change-Id: I251cb1995ae083e8d30c3b317151b43d2ba7f073
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-10 12:48:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/05279598f3e2e0da440a076328302ab064c01f55', 'message': "Fixup default open_files_limit for galera

Change-Id: I251cb1995ae083e8d30c3b317151b43d2ba7f073

commit_message:
Fixup default open_files_limit for galera

We are currently setting this to -1, which is not a valid
value according to mariadb docs (see bug report below).
This review just makes the value 0, on the assumption that
the -1 was meant to represent 'infinite'. Note that at
least in the pacemaker case we *are* passing 16384 to the
resource arguments with --open-files-limit=16384

Closes-Bug: 1524809

Change-Id: I251cb1995ae083e8d30c3b317151b43d2ba7f073
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/48/255848/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'open_files_limit' => '0',

commit_message:
Allow to allow_resize_to_same_host to true in nova

To be able to resize a ephemeral node, we need to set
allow_resize_to_same_host to true in nova.

Default is set to false like OpenStack default.

Closes-bug: #1535669

Change-Id: Ie4c701e16319399b4d1d8b09efc62db30b6e1444
Depends-On: Ib3e0d53c1c219fd6d83f940053b833163c51dcb3
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/62/269562/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NovaAllowResizeToSameHost: default: false description: Allow resize a VM on same compute, needed for ephemeral VM type: boolean allow_resize_to_same_host: {get_param: NovaAllowResizeToSameHost}

Enables configuring Gluster(glusterfs, glusternfs or glusternative)
backend for the Manila service.

commit_message:
Secure the mongodb server

In the current state, the mongodb deployed on the overcloud is wide open
to any connection from within the network it is listening on.

This review aims to secure the mongodb deployed in the overcloud by
doing few things :

  * Creating a 'root' account
  * Creating a ceilometer account that can only connect to the
    ceilometer db.
  * Enabling authentication mechanism (MONGODB-CR)

Change-Id: I66a5709c9b564c76e136589dd9b934066e01e396
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/85/235385/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mongodb::server::auth: true mongodb::server::create_admin: true mongodb::server::admin_username: root mongodb::server::store_creds: true

commit_message:
WIP: Optimize startup by pulling images ahead of time

By pulling one container, we can accelerate the startup of
the compute node.  We added a new variable for the nova compute
image.  This could be swapped out for the base image when we add in
the controller.

Change-Id: Ifdf4b55e24bb0eafc26f2c76b7330df13f9d5ee0
Signed-off-by: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-by: Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/30/239330/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /usr/bin/systemctl restart docker.service # Optimization: We start pulling here so we don't have to wait for the agent # to come up in order to pull the containers. /usr/bin/docker pull $docker_registry/$docker_compute_image

commit_message:
Docker controller role configured via Puppet

Add a containerized controller node in the overcloud.
Configuration files are generated via OpenStack Puppet modules
which are then used to externally configure kolla containers for
each OpenStack service.

This uses Centos AtomicOS as a base operating system and requires that we bootstrap
the image with a container which contains the required os-collect-config agent
hooks to support running puppet, shell scripts, and docker compose.

Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I520328899418a7fc022d05f805298ea12e85e222

subject: Make the NeutronMechanismDrivers into a proper list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-19 08:12:28.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml', 'controller.yaml', 'compute.yaml', 'puppet/compute-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/controller-puppet.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/f1e02a55545bcd45bed2b577dca9370f1c0a6fad', 'message': "Make the NeutronMechanismDrivers into a proper list

The NeutronMechanismDrivers parameter was defined as a string
when it should be a list as per Kilo docs @ [1].

The proposed cisco driver patches at [2] are using the resulting
hiera data (which we do pass even though it hasn't to date been
consumed and applied, see [3]) to set ml2 configuration appropriate
to their needs.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/kilo/config-reference/content/networking-options-plugins-ml2.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/198754/10/puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp
[3] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1254897

Change-Id: If1434f094b5ccdc20cb24f7b41d8c8309c664744
"}]
commit_message:
Make the NeutronMechanismDrivers into a proper list

The NeutronMechanismDrivers parameter was defined as a string
when it should be a list as per Kilo docs @ [1].

The proposed cisco driver patches at [2] are using the resulting
hiera data (which we do pass even though it hasn't to date been
consumed and applied, see [3]) to set ml2 configuration appropriate
to their needs.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/kilo/config-reference/content/networking-options-plugins-ml2.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/198754/10/puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp
[3] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1254897

Change-Id: If1434f094b5ccdc20cb24f7b41d8c8309c664744
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/04/214504/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default: ["openvswitch", ] Comma-separated list of networking mechanism driver entrypoints to be loaded from the neutron.ml2.mechanism_drivers namespace for the Neutron tenant network. type: comma_delimited_list neutron_mechanism_drivers: str_replace: template: "['DRIVERS']" params: DRIVERS: list_join: - "','" - {get_param: NeutronMechanismDrivers}
deleted_lines: default: 'openvswitch' The mechanism drivers for the Neutron tenant network. To specify multiple values, use a comma separated string, like so: 'openvswitch,l2_population' type: string neutron_mechanism_drivers: {get_param: NeutronMechanismDrivers}

commit_message:
Add metering agent as neutron-server plugin

Enable the metering agent service plugin and start the
neutron-metering-agent. Also add the neutron-metering-agent
as a pacemaker resource in the overcloud controller
pacemaker manifest

Change-Id: If9f2c5593eadabef7b7cf6b2e7959bc4439c831d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/70/179370/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - 'metering'

commit_message:
Allow the database password to be configurable

Currently we have one password for
all service databases and that password
is not configurable. This change makes
this password configurable.

(Eventually we need to move to one
configurable password per service database, this
is a step towards this)

This change is for both undercloud and overcloud

Change-Id: I3e85b96972ae1b2b245513b76104fd92cac12542

commit_message:
Update Amulet defs, series metadata and c-h sync

- Sync charm helpers if applicable.

- Fix test executable hashbags for virtualenv prep.

- Add Yakkety-Newton Amulet test definitions.

- Prep Xenial-Ocata Amulet test definitions (not yet enabled).

- Prep Zesty-Ocata Amulet test definitions (not yet enabled).

- Remove Precise charm series metadata if present.

- Remove Precise Amulet test definitions if present.

Change-Id: I12f3c996ee0478e8de59c3c32a4c1730523b5949

commit_message:
Lock in DHCP agent based on network_id

All cache operations and dnsmasq process operations
are scoped to a network ID so we can always safely
perform concurrent actions on different network IDs.
This patch adjusts the DHCP agent to lock based on
network ID rather than having a global lock for every
operation.

sync_state calls are still protected with a reader/writer
lock to ensure that when sync_state needs to run, all
other operations are blocked.

Related-Bug: #1548190
Change-Id: I56010dc801d82be56f12e834c5164316872c2f8b

commit_message:
Added retries for db_sync

If db sync fails, it is never retried leading to errors. So, this
patch adds retries for db_sync to avoid sync fails.

Change-Id: Ieb5f39dbc53bb7a1a2031eb139bb3d8cda579cb4
Closes-Bug: #1628580
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-congress refs/changes/39/407339/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :try_sleep => 5, :tries => 10,

subject: libvirt: Resize an existing disk
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-28 11:55:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c0cb12b29b99ebf3af48c4eac540daf116c330a4', 'message': 'libvirt: Resize an existing disk

The soon to be deleted `Image.cache` method used to skip the
`create_image` call if the disk already existed, and instead just resize
& preallocate. Extract that functionality into `Image.resize`, so that
driver can explicitly do the same in the disk already exists case.

Co-authored-by: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Implements: bp/imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: I8485479cd3f6829c1d7cdf0a1001592e77f720b5
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Resize an existing disk

The soon to be deleted `Image.cache` method used to skip the
`create_image` call if the disk already existed, and instead just resize
& preallocate. Extract that functionality into `Image.resize`, so that
driver can explicitly do the same in the disk already exists case.

Co-authored-by: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Implements: bp/imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: I8485479cd3f6829c1d7cdf0a1001592e77f720b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/403647/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def resize(self, size): """Resize an existing disk.""" virtual_size = self.get_disk_size(self.path) self._resize_disk(size, virtual_size) self._preallocate_disk(size) def _resize_disk(self, size, virtual_size): if size and size > virtual_size: self.resize_image(size) def _preallocate_disk(self, size): if size and self.preallocate and self._can_fallocate(): utils.execute('fallocate', '-n', '-l', size, self.path)

commit_message:
Copy get-pip script into the release folder

To ensure that a known good version of the get-pip script is
available without having to fetch it from the internet, the
script that was used to setup the repo is copied into the
repo release folder.

Partial-Bug: #1633105
Change-Id: I3735ec50d51e10d0bc4a7f6677a800444fb33912
(cherry picked from commit da99913ce7e54cbaaaabff29e443a113289bdf32)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-29 12:49:11.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh', 'functions.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/a450b9c18e6ec0f91b1d874eb116d9ffc223055b', 'message': 'grenade: Distinguish base/target branch override

This change allows to use grenade with the following scenario:

* checkout stable/mitaka for all projects except for one we want
stable/foobar
* upgrade all projects to master expect one to stable/foobar-next

The current OVERRIDE_$PROJECT_PROJECT_BRANCH concept set the branch
for the old and the new workspace. When for this scenario we want a

Change-Id: I41250e61949d3fe3e6dfede8d28eb75fc133bb34
'}]
commit_message:
grenade: Distinguish base/target branch override

This change allows to use grenade with the following scenario:

* checkout stable/mitaka for all projects except for one we want
stable/foobar
* upgrade all projects to master expect one to stable/foobar-next

The current OVERRIDE_$PROJECT_PROJECT_BRANCH concept set the branch
for the old and the new workspace. When for this scenario we want a
different branch for both workspace.

Change-Id: I41250e61949d3fe3e6dfede8d28eb75fc133bb34
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/79/335479/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # override_suffix: The suffix for OVERRIDE environnement variables# The zuul ref for the project specific OVERRIDE_$PROJECT_PROJECT_BRANCH_$OVERRIDE_SUFFIX if specified# The tip of the project specific OVERRIDE_$PROJECT_PROJECT_BRANCH_$OVERRIDE_SUFFIX if specified local override_suffix=$3 [[ ! -z $override_suffix ]] && override_suffix="_${override_suffix}" local project_branch_var="\$OVERRIDE_${uc_project}_PROJECT_BRANCH${override_suffix}" else project_branch_var="\$OVERRIDE_${uc_project}_PROJECT_BRANCH" project_branch=`eval echo ${project_branch_var}` if [[ "$project_branch" != "" ]]; then branch=$project_branch fi local project_git_base_var="\$OVERRIDE_${uc_project}_GIT_BASE${override_suffix}" else project_git_base_var="\$OVERRIDE_${uc_project}_GIT_BASE" project_git_base=`eval echo ${project_git_base_var}` if [[ "$project_git_base" != "" ]]; then git_base=$project_git_base fi local override_suffix=$3 setup_project $PROJECT $base_branch $override_suffix

subject: Disable SSH verification on mons online check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-06 15:28:43.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/ceph_get_mon_host.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ceph_client/commit/a039741521ae90b5003c21284c93dc887baa76df', 'message': "Disable SSH verification on mons online check

Since we are only trying to find out whether the host is online
at this point it is not necessary to perform host key verification,
since the SSH command being used does not mirror the ansible
setting of host_key_checking. If ansible host_key_checking is
enabled then the set_fact task below is likely to be skipped due
to:

u'stderr': u'Host key verification failed.', u'rc': 255

Change-Id: Ib4c2043219670f0753e76d330a2316cae10751f1
"}]
commit_message:
Disable SSH verification on mons online check

Since we are only trying to find out whether the host is online
at this point it is not necessary to perform host key verification,
since the SSH command being used does not mirror the ansible
setting of host_key_checking. If ansible host_key_checking is
enabled then the set_fact task below is likely to be skipped due
to:

u'stderr': u'Host key verification failed.', u'rc': 255

Change-Id: Ib4c2043219670f0753e76d330a2316cae10751f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ceph_client refs/changes/67/407567/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local_action: > command ssh -o ConnectTimeout=1 -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no {{ item }} exit
deleted_lines: local_action: command ssh -o ConnectTimeout=1 {{ item }} exit

commit_message:
Add custom interfaces file and update docs for PowerVM RMC

This patch adds templating a custom Nova interfaces file for PowerVM only
to support doing mixed IPV4-only and IPV6-only deployments. It also adds
documentation for configuration of PowerVM RMC.

Change-Id: Ib1ff51c95998bbc3183ea9b896dc8fa2dfbc0435
Closes-Bug: #1643988

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 20:38:13.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/keepalived.pp', 'manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/16a020266420ad78cb4538f08f3fb05d35596622', 'message': "Adds auto-detection for VIP interfaces

Previously the ctrl plane VIP would default to 'br-ex' which in non-vlan
deployments ends up being the wrong interface.  The public VIP interface
was also defaulted to 'br-ex' which would be incorrect for vlan based
deployments.  Since a user has already given the nic template (and in
most cases the subnet that corresponds to the nic) the installer should
be able to figure out which interface the public/control vip should be
on.

These changes enable that type of auto-detection, unless a user
explicitly overrides the heat parameters for ControlVirtualInterface and
PublicVirtualInterface.  Also removes calling keepalived from haproxy
now that the services are composed separately on the Controller role.

Partial-Bug: 1606632

Change-Id: I05105fce85be8ace986db351cdca2916f405ed04
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 87763459ae57614e092f772595a03e7d552f96d1)
"}]
commit_message:
Adds auto-detection for VIP interfaces

Previously the ctrl plane VIP would default to 'br-ex' which in non-vlan
deployments ends up being the wrong interface.  The public VIP interface
was also defaulted to 'br-ex' which would be incorrect for vlan based
deployments.  Since a user has already given the nic template (and in
most cases the subnet that corresponds to the nic) the installer should
be able to figure out which interface the public/control vip should be
on.

These changes enable that type of auto-detection, unless a user
explicitly overrides the heat parameters for ControlVirtualInterface and
PublicVirtualInterface.  Also removes calling keepalived from haproxy
now that the services are composed separately on the Controller role.

Partial-Bug: 1606632

Change-Id: I05105fce85be8ace986db351cdca2916f405ed04
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 87763459ae57614e092f772595a03e7d552f96d1)

commit_message:
Fix cluster relation unnecessary service restarts

The logic introduced in commit 619ce065 to formalise database
initialisation did not support the leader switching and re-runs
of the shared-db relation. This resulted in extraneous service
restarts. We avoid this by adding some extra logic around this
code.

Change-Id: If988331e552da930eff868abded323014fd50f04
Closes-Bug: 1561927
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-cinder refs/changes/54/402954/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NOTE: this must only be called from peer relation context. # If this unit has previously received an init notification (and echoed # it) then we can ignore further notifications. if not echoed_init_id: if init_id and local_unit() not in init_id: log("Restarting cinder services following db initialisation", level=DEBUG) if not is_unit_paused_set(): for svc in enabled_services(): service_restart(svc) # Set echo if init_id and local_unit() not in init_id:
deleted_lines: if (init_id and init_id != echoed_init_id and local_unit() not in init_id): log("Restarting cinder services following db initialisation", level=DEBUG) if not is_unit_paused_set(): for svc in enabled_services(): service_restart(svc) # Set echo

commit_message:
[docs][5] Re-design docs to cover all user-groups

First pack of changes in upcoming chain to redesign Rally docs.
All information related to Rally plugins separated and refactored.
Modified files fit 80 symbols margin where possible.

[TODO] continue with other parts of the docs:
       - Contribute to Rally
       - Request New Features
       - Project Info
[TODO] add 80 symbols margin check similar to what
       Performance Documentation has

Change-Id: I5d19a2bbbcdd9be463793bce50de62c5608b6157

revisions:

- This change extends the function signture
  of the vif.py set_config_* functions to
  optionally accepth the host object.
- This is required to support host specifc
  features that depend on the vif type chosen

Change-Id: I9b116f64864863ade32a99fcda9051b60ff7fbde
'}]
commit_message:
add host to vif.py set_config_* functions

- This change extends the function signture
  of the vif.py set_config_* functions to
  optionally accepth the host object.
- This is required to support host specifc
  features that depend on the vif type chosen
  e.g. vhost-user and multiqueue

Change-Id: I9b116f64864863ade32a99fcda9051b60ff7fbde
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/97/402097/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _set_config_VIFBridge(self, instance, vif, conf, host=None): def _set_config_VIFOpenVSwitch(self, instance, vif, conf, host=None): func(instance, vif, conf, host)
deleted_lines: def _set_config_VIFBridge(self, instance, vif, conf): def _set_config_VIFOpenVSwitch(self, instance, vif, conf): func(instance, vif, conf)

commit_message:
Fix placement API version history 1.1 title

This needs to use dashes otherwise it doesn't render
properly in the docs. Also adds an informative title
for the 1.1 microversion since that seems to be a pattern
we're going with now in 1.2.

Change-Id: I9fbb7d7f4fee024fa2afb14b190c3ad403b7ed61

commit_message:
placement: Perform build list of standard classes once

To prevent rebuilding list of standard resource classes every time
destroy() method is called on ResourceClass object, move it to class
attribute. Also, removed get_standards call in destroy method of
ResourceClass, and simply access list through the cache object.

Change-Id: I3569bd5479966dfd895b31c77a74cc8e9ad5493a
blueprint: custom-resource-classes
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/62/406062/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # List of dict of all standard resource classes, where every list item # have a form {'id': <ID>, 'name': <NAME>} STANDARDS = [{'id': fields.ResourceClass.STANDARD.index(s), 'name': s} for s in fields.ResourceClass.STANDARD]
deleted_lines: def get_standards(self): """Return a list of {'id': <ID>, 'name': <NAME> for all standard resource classes. """ return [{'id': fields.ResourceClass.STANDARD.index(s), 'name': s} for s in fields.ResourceClass.STANDARD]

subject: placement: REST API for resource classes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 19:35:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/04bf65f70d8772fe696257c23fe80264abfe3149', 'message': 'placement: REST API for resource classes

This patch adds support for a REST API for CRUD operations on custom
resource classes:

    GET /resource_classes: return all resource classes
    POST /resource_classes: create a new custom resource class
    DELETE /resource_classes/{name}: deletes a custom resource class
    GET /resource_classes/{name}: get a single resource class

Change-Id: I99e7bcfe27938e5e4d50ac3005690ac1255d4c5e

commit_message:
placement: REST API for resource classes

This patch adds support for a REST API for CRUD operations on custom
resource classes:

    GET /resource_classes: return all resource classes
    POST /resource_classes: create a new custom resource class
    PUT /resource_classes/{name}: update name of custom resource class
    DELETE /resource_classes/{name}: deletes a custom resource class
    GET /resource_classes/{name}: get a single resource class

Change-Id: I99e7bcfe27938e5e4d50ac3005690ac1255d4c5e
blueprint: custom-resource-classes
